gcci.text: H100 spot prices stabilizing around $3.33/hr as inventory rebuilds, with capex shifting toward liquid-cooled racks for dense AI workloads.

gtpi.text: Token input costs at $1.35/1M tokens signal intense API price compression as distilled models force efficiency gains across the stack.

gagl.text: 120 TWh annual load exposes grid vulnerability, prompting SMR nuclear adoption for baseload stability in AI hyperscale regions.

aipi.text: Valuation compression suggests sector maturation rather than bubble risk, with sustainable growth focusing on inference efficiency rather than pure parameter scaling.
